title: Watch: Kolkata fans erupt as Lionel Messi touches down at 2.26am; video viral
description: Football icon Lionel Messi arrived in Kolkata to a massive reception, with thousands of fans braving the cold to welcome him. Despite tight security, "Messi mania" gripped the city as he began his GOAT India Tour 2025, which includes meetings with dignitaries and football events across four cities.

title: 'Dhurandhar' Day 8: Ranveer–Akshaye starrer earns Rs 30 cr, weekend total hits Rs 250 cr
description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is making waves, crossing the Rs 250 crore mark and eyeing historical box office records. The spy thriller's second Friday collections surged, surpassing its opening day and showing immense growth. With strong word-of-mouth, the film is poised for a massive second weekend, potentially outperforming major hits and setting new benchmarks for Ranveer Singh's career.

title: Mridangam exponent K.V. Prasad and bharatanatyam exponent G. Narendra honoured
description: During the inauguration of the 69th Margazhi Mela, while Mr. Prasad was conferred the title ‘Sangeetha Choodamani’, Mr. Narendra was given the title ‘Nrithya Choodamani’

title: AI Express eyes IndiGo pilots, its own aviators up in arms
description: Air India Express pilots are protesting the recruitment of new A320 captains, fearing reduced flying hours and pay.  Around 100 pilots have written to management, questioning external hiring when internal utilization is low. They worry this will further impact their ability to meet contracted flying hours and affect their overall compensation.

title: Cold night, dark lane, fatal attack: JEE aspirant stabbed to death in Delhi; youth dreamt of being engineer
description: An 18-year-old JEE aspirant was fatally stabbed during a robbery attempt in Delhi after he resisted giving up his phone. The incident occurred on a poorly lit shortcut, highlighting safety concerns in the area. Police have arrested four individuals, including minors, who admitted to the crime to fund their drug addiction.

title: BJP leader Amarinder Singh calls BJP ‘rigid,’ praises Congress’s flexibility
description: Punjab is a different area. Look at it, everywhere the BJP is pulling through, why not in Punjab? See previous elections, how many seats have some, hardly any, says Captain Amarinder

title: Divine power of proper worship
DGCA removes 4 officials overseeing IndiGo ops
description: 'Failed To Flag Crew Shortfall Under New Rules'

title: Digitised states at higher cyber risk, says report
description: A new report reveals a surprising trend: wealthier, more digitalized Indian states are more vulnerable to cyberattacks. While richer states boast better defenses, they face a higher volume of threats. Conversely, poorer states, despite weaker defenses, experience fewer attacks. Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Telangana offer the least cybercrime protection, while Rajasthan and Assam lead in security.

title: 56 ex-judges throw weight behind Madras HC judge
description: Say Impeachment Move A Brazen Attempt To 'Browbeat Judiciary'

title: More than 400 protesting sanitation workers detained in Chennai
description: The workers protested on Kamarajar Salai and near the Secretariat, demanding that the Corporation withdraw the move to outsource conservancy operations at two zones in the city

title: This Hidma's bow & arrow shoots at straw targets
description: Month-Long Bastar Olympics Conclude Today

title: Trinamool accuses BJP of ‘enabling’ violence against Bengali-speaking people in Odisha’s Malkangiri
description: Tensions flared in Odisha’s Malkangiri district between tribal and Bengal-speaking populations, with an armed mob allegedly torching houses in the Bengali-dominant MV-26 village

title: Karur stampede case: Something going wrong in Madras HC, says SC
description: The Supreme Court expressed strong disapproval of the Madras High Court's handling of the Karur stampede case, stating "something is going wrong in the HC." The apex court rejected the Tamil Nadu government's plea to let its own commission investigate the incident, emphasizing the need for a fair and impartial inquiry. The SC will examine the HC registrar general's report.

Rahul Gandhi asks for air pollution debate in Lok Sabha, govt agrees
description: Rahul Gandhi has demanded a Lok Sabha debate on the severe air pollution plaguing Indian cities, urging the government to present a concrete plan. Meanwhile, Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' and is predicted to turn 'severe' by Sunday, with light winds failing to disperse pollutants. Moderate fog is also expected.

title: Exclusive | Under scanner: The string of approvals that made killer Goa nightclub a reality
Mohan Yadav says ‘elimination’ of Maoism his biggest feat; Congress rakes up farmer issues, debt
description: The Chief Minister said that the State has received investment proposals of more than ₹32 lakh crore in the past two years and those of ₹8.57 lakh crore have been materialised so far

title: Messi mania grips Kolkata as thousands welcome Argentine icon
description: The Barcelona legend's 2.26 a.m. touchdown in the early hours of Saturday (December 13, 2025) sent the city into an frenzy.

title: Two die after four-storey temple in South Africa collapses; more people trapped under rubble
description: Rescuers cautiously drilling through the rubble to find survivors stopped operations close to midnight amid difficult conditions, vowing to return at the first light on Saturday morning

title: In terror acts, rights of accused subservient to national interest: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has ruled that individual liberty, while crucial, cannot override national security concerns in UAPA cases.  Upholding this, the court denied bail to accused in the Jnaneshwari Express derailment case, emphasizing that barbaric acts endangering national integrity are not excusable, even after prolonged incarceration.  The apex court stressed the need for expeditious trials in such grave matters.

title: BJP targets Mamata over contradictory claims of filing SIR enumeration form
description: Since the start of the SIR in West Bengal on November 4, Trinamool Congress chairperson has repeatedly said that she will not fill the SIR enumeration form till all the people of the state have filled in their forms.

title: Laws governing insurance, stock markets to be rewritten
description: The Union Cabinet has approved significant reforms for the stock market and insurance sectors. The plan includes allowing 100% foreign investment in insurance, aiming to boost penetration and consumer choice.

title: Ahead of PM Modi's 3-nation tour, FTA with Oman gets Cabinet nod
description: Prime Minister Modi's upcoming visit to Oman is poised to forge a robust economic and strategic alliance, potentially including a free trade agreement and a joint defense partnership. India anticipates receiving spare parts for its retired Jaguar fleet from Oman.

title: News from the world of Education: December 13, 2025
description: Information on admissions, scholarships, new courses, research studies and other events at schools and colleges

title: Rs 12k cr for 2-phase census, will allow self-enumeration
description: India gears up for Census 2027 with a Rs 11,718 crore budget, marking the first digital enumeration and inclusion of a caste count. The two-phase exercise, starting April 2026, will utilize mobile apps for data collection. Reference date is March 1, 2027, with special provisions for snow-bound regions. This census aims to provide accurate population data for future development planning.

title: Higher education upgrade: Bill on single regulator gets nod
description: The Union Cabinet has approved the Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhikshan Bill, aiming to consolidate higher education regulation under a single authority, excluding medical and legal fields. This move seeks to simplify governance and enhance academic quality. Meanwhile, a parliamentary committee will question IndiGo, DGCA, and ministry officials regarding recent flight cancellations and pilot rest rule implementation.

title: No Cabinet mantri present, Rajya Sabha adjourned for 10 minutes
Iran seizes oil tanker in Gulf of Oman: Report
description: An oil tanker carrying six million litres of contraband diesel fuel has been boarded off the coast of the Sea of Oman

title: New window for coal linkage auctions to give push to reforms
description: India has launched CoalSETU, a new policy for long-term coal linkage auctions aimed at industrial use and exports. This dedicated window allows any domestic industrial buyer to bid, simplifying procedures and boosting the utilization of coal reserves. Fuel supply agreements can extend up to 15 years, with flexible use within group companies, potentially reducing imports and creating export opportunities.

title: Cabinet clears SHANTI bill to open nuclear power to pvt sector
description: The Union Cabinet has greenlit a bill to open India's nuclear power sector to private players, a move crucial for achieving 100 GW nuclear capacity by 2047. The SHANTI Bill proposes changes to civil liability laws, caps supplier liability, and allows up to 49% foreign direct investment. This aims to boost domestic energy production and meet net-zero targets.

title: Congress MP claims BJP neta was drunk during Rahul Gandhi's speech
description: A Congress MP has accused a senior BJP member of attending Lok Sabha proceedings "drunk" during Rahul Gandhi's speech on electoral reforms.  The MP cited the individual's "repeated gestures" and "tottering" as evidence, urging the BJP to prevent such incidents. This allegation follows a recent row over a TMC MP allegedly "vaping" in the House, highlighting concerns over parliamentary decorum.

title: Horoscope Today for December 13, 2025: Key Astrological Trends Affecting Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo, and Other Zodiac Signs
Goa nightclub fire: The party that took a tragic turn
description: On December 6, a fire claimed 25 lives during a party at Birch by Romeo Lane, an establishment in Arpora in Goa. The restaurant-cum-club was built on a salt pan and had only a narrow entrance and exit, survivors and activists allege. Rishikesh Bahadur Desai reports on the night’s happenings and the worries of Goans about unregulated real-estate development, marked by illegal construction, lax fire safety, and poor crowd control

title: Anurag Thakur seeks action against TMC MP for vaping in Parliament
description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has received a complaint from BJP MP Anurag Thakur regarding a TMC lawmaker allegedly using an e-cigarette inside the House. Thakur highlighted this as a serious breach of parliamentary rules and the Prohibition of Electronic Cigarettes Act, 2019. The Lok Sabha secretariat is reviewing proceedings for appropriate action.

title: Formula 4 Championship: Three-way battle for top honours
description: Fifteen-year-old Kenyan racer Shane Chandaria (Chennai Turbo Riders) arrives in Chennai as the points leader with 158.

title: Govt approves 125-day rural job bill to replace MGNREGA
description: The government has approved a bill to replace MGNREGA with the Pujya Bapu Gramin Rozgar Guarantee Bill, promising 125 workdays per household. This move aims to counter opposition criticism on funding and boost employment claims, particularly in rural areas. Projects will align with Viksit Bharat National Infra Stack, prioritizing water security.

title: Record-breaking Suryavanshi powers India to big 234-run win over UAE in U19 Asia Cup opener
description: Vaibhav unleashed a stunning display of batting, hitting 14 sixes — the most by any batter in a single innings in the U19 level — en-route to his breathtaking innings

title: Savarkar never got due recognition: Amit Shah
description: Home Minister Amit Shah lauded Vinayak Damodar Savarkar's fight against untouchability and social evils, stating he never received due recognition. Unveiling a statue, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat honored the ideologue's enduring legacy. Shah highlighted Savarkar's patriotism, reformist zeal, and literary contributions, emphasizing his resilience during imprisonment and unwavering belief in India's freedom.

title: Need to take development to Maoist-affected areas, says CM Sai
description: In the past two years, 505 Naxalites have been neutralised, 2,386 have surrendered, and 1,901 have been arrested, says Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

title: Very optimistic: India on possibility of sealing trade deal with Oman during PM Modi's visit
description: We have here immense faith that this agreement, if signed during this visit, will significantly deepen the economic ties between India and Oman, says Arun Chatterjee, a Secretary in the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA)

title: 70% of poll promises fulfilled in two years, says Rajasthan CM

Megan Thee Stallion–Klay Thompson cheating rumor explodes amid breakup buzz
description: Social media erupted with breakup rumors about Megan Thee Stallion and Klay Thompson. A single X post alleged cheating and a split. The internet quickly spread the claim, despite a complete lack of proof. No credible news outlets or official statements have confirmed the story. This highlights how quickly unverified information can trend online.

title: Mirwaiz asks Omar govt to stop arrest of people in decades old cases
description: Hurriyat chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq urged the Omar Abdullah government to halt arrests in old cases, citing harassment and anxiety. He highlighted the plight of thousands of Kashmiri prisoners and called for a review of old case handling and transfer of detainees back to J&K.

title: IND vs SA: Suryakumar, Gill’s poor run a cause of concern for India
description: Gill’s performance, after replacing Sanju Samson as the Men in Blue’s T20I opener, has been a let-down.

title: J&K: LG hands appointment letters to kin of Nowgam police station blast victims
description: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha met families of those killed in the Nowgam police station blast, providing them with appointment letters on compassionate grounds. He lauded the J&K Police for dismantling a terror network, emphasizing national support for the affected families. The blast, described as accidental, occurred during the examination of seized explosives.

title: NBA stars whose celebrity partners turned heads on and off the court
description: Love stories between NBA stars and established celebrities have often stolen the spotlight, blending sports and entertainment. From Khloe Kardashian's dramatic romance with Tristan Thompson to Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union's powerful advocacy, these high-profile unions captivated fans.  Other notable pairings include Teyana Taylor and Iman Shumpert, Amelia Vega and Al Horford, and La La and Carmelo Anthony.

title: Jaish terrorist held with M-5 rifle near IB in J&K’s Akhnoor
description: Alert BSF troops apprehended a Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorist near the Indo-Pak border in Akhnoor, Jammu and Kashmir. The operative, identified as Abdul Khalik from Rajouri, was found with an M-5 rifle and magazines. He had illegally migrated to Pakistan in 2021 and was handed over to local police for further investigation.

title: Donald Trump’s $100,000 H-1B visa fee draws legal challenge from California, other states
Congress to boycott first day of Chhattisgarh Assembly session: LoP Mahant
description: I have made a decision. I am telling my colleagues in front of you that we are completely boycotting the Assembly session on December 14, says Senior Congress leader Charandas Mahant

title: I know how badly I want to win an Olympic medal — that hunger is in me: Nikhat Zareen
description: The richly decorated boxer has her eyes set on the ultimate prize. In this conversation after claiming gold in the World Boxing Cup Finals, the two-time World champion talks about the relief of ending a medal drought, what her near- and long-term plans are, how she bounces back so often, and why she doesn’t discuss her boxing life with her family

title: Tunisian court sentences opposition figure Moussi to 12 years in prison
Teachers asked to report stray dogs, outrage in J&K
description: Jammu & Kashmir's education department has mandated teachers to report and manage stray dog populations, sparking outrage from political parties and teachers' unions. Critics deem the directives "shocking" and "atrocious," arguing they undermine educators' dignity and professional roles. The orders, however, are reportedly based on Supreme Court guidelines amidst a surge in dog-bite incidents.

title: Sivaganga custodial death case: CBI names DSP, Inspector as accused

The Heat's history of building around stars makes them a strong contender.

This development follows escalating violence and displacement of hundreds of thousands.

Epstein scandal: US House panel releases 19 photos; Trump, Clinton appear in images
description: House Oversight Committee Democrats released 19 photos from Jeffrey Epstein's estate, showing interactions with figures like Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, and Bill Gates. The images, part of a larger cache, offer glimpses into these associations. Republicans criticized the selective release, calling it a political tactic against Trump, while Democrats demand further transparency.

description: Microsoft AI chief Mustafa Suleyman reveals his working-class London upbringing shaped his tech vision. Now he champions AI for social good and universal basic income.
